bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing qemu-system-x86 from 'read' accesses on the file +pci:0000:01:00.0.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: SELinux is preventing qemu-system-x86 from 'read' accesses on the file +pci:0000:01:00.0.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that qemu-system-x86 should be allowed read access on the +pci:0000:01:00.0 file by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'qemu-system-x86' --raw | audit2allow -M my-qemusystemx86 # semodule -X 300 -i my-qemusystemx86.pp
Additional Information: Source Context unconfined_u:unconfined_r:svirt_t:s0:c5,c359 Target Context system_u:object_r:udev_var_run_t:s0 Target Objects +pci:0000:01:00.0 [ file ] Source qemu-system-x86 Source Path qemu-system-x86 Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages Policy RPM selinux-policy-3.13.1-211.fc25.noarch Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Enforcing Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.8.0-0.rc5.git1.1.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Sep 6 15:52:10 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 Alert Count 3 First Seen 2016-09-11 17:21:41 CEST Last Seen 2016-09-11 17:21:46 CEST Local ID df6eb834-bc32-43ae-82b5-10b4c5cb0571
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1473607306.430:402): avc: denied { read } for pid=11747 comm="qemu-system-x86" name="+pci:0000:01:00.0" dev="tmpfs" ino=13537 scontext=unconfined_u:unconfined_r:svirt_t:s0:c5,c359 tcontext=system_u:object_r:udev_var_run_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=0
Hash: qemu-system-x86,svirt_t,udev_var_run_t,file,read
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-211.fc25.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.8.0 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.8.0-0.rc5.git1.1.fc25.x86_64 type: libreport
Potential duplicate: bug 1276873
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
